node.title: Toowoomba Hospital visits restricted after COVID scare as Queensland records no new cases
node.alt: Queensland Health Minister Yvette D'Ath provides a COVID-19 update
node.description: Queensland records zero new COVID-19 cases as authorities call for more tests after several positive cases have been infectious in different parts of the state in recent days.
node.content:
["Queensland has recorded zero new\u00a0COVID-19 cases after the state's far north was put on alert over the weekend\u00a0when it was revealed an infectious traveller\u00a0spent time in the region.", "Several positive cases have been infectious in various parts of the state in recent days, with Health Minister\u00a0Yvette D'Ath confirming a close contact of a confirmed COVID-19 case has visited Toowoomba Hospital.", "People are now being asked not to visit the hospital.", "\"We are limiting the restrictions of visitors to the hospital,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "\"Of course, we will still allow for end-of-life care visits and palliative care.\"", "Acting Chief Health Officer\u00a0Peter Aitken said the relative had\u00a0tested negative.", "\"But as an abundance of caution, we're just making sure at the current stage that we are restricting visitor numbers,\" Dr Aitken said.", "Queensland Health\u00a0issued contact tracing alerts for locations in Cairns and Mission Beach on yesterday\u00a0afternoon after\u00a0a person tested positive for COVID-19\u00a0in the Northern Territory after travelling through the region.", "Dr Aitken said it was \"good news\" no\u00a0cases were recorded in Cairns, with the\u00a0woman potentially infectious in the\u00a0community for up to five days.", "The woman spent time in Victoria before flying to Cairns from Adelaide and then to Darwin, where she tested positive.", "NT\u00a0Chief Minister Michael Gunner said the woman was\u00a0fined more than $5,000 for lying on her border entry form.", "A hotspot declaration will be lifted on Katherine in the NT\u00a0from 4:00pm\u00a0this afternoon.", "
Booster shots available as vaccine milestone nears
", "Dr Aitken said vaccination rates in the far north on Saturday and Sunday were \"really good\".", "\"One hundred and nineteen\u00a0out of the 198 vaccination doses at Cairns Convention Centre were first doses, which is absolutely brilliant,\" he\u00a0said.", "\"The more people we have coming forward getting those first doses, the better it is for Queenslanders as a whole.\"", "It comes as COVID-19 booster shots become\u00a0available from vaccination hubs\u00a0today as the state nears 80 per cent of Queenslanders over 16 having had one dose of a vaccine.", "Vaccine coordinator police Deputy Commissioner Shane Chelepy told ABC Brisbane once the state\u00a0reached\u00a0that level of vaccination, a rough timeline for the 80 per cent fully vaccinated milestone would become clearer.", "\"Around about four weeks \u2026 because we still do a lot of Moderna vaccinations, which is a four-week gap and we've still got a little bit of AstraZeneca being vaccinated, so it's around about the four weeks after we get our first dose but it does depend on which vaccine is being used the most,\" he said.", "Deputy Commissioner\u00a0Chelepy also urged vaccinated Queenslanders to check if they are due for a booster or third shot.", "\"What we're after is someone who's had their full two doses of vaccine more than six months ago, you're ready to have your booster now,\" he said.", "\"So you can either book that through our normal booking system or you can just walk in to one of our hubs. With the GP you'll need to book.\"", "Queensland Health administered 10,626 vaccines yesterday with just over 5,500 doses at Bunnings stores over the weekend.", "Ms D'Ath said 79.49 per cent of Queenslanders over 16 have now received their first dose and 67.14 per cent of Queenslanders have had both.", "", "
Outbreak: How Australia lost control of the Delta variant
"]
